column4: hello... anyone around that knows about the sony-laptop module?
anyone here running ubuntu on SONY LAPTOP?
Yes, me
hi guys
i need some help with WWAN
http://www.linux.it/~malattia/wiki/index.php/Sony-laptop
this website is where i got most of the info..
this is a module built into the kernel...
I can't seem to POWER ON my WWAN cad
i heard your problem with WiFi. Sounds like you might have a DNS issue.. check your dns server address
The DNS server is correct
what are u getting for ping result?
When I tried to ping the router, it says destination host unreachable.. and the from IP it shows is wrong
release and renew your computers IP

I have 192.168.1.11 set for the WiFi and 192.168.1.41 set for the wired network which is currently disconnected.... When I ping the router, it says From 192.168.1.41 icmp_seq=1 Destination host unreachable... I don't know why its showing that IP instead of 192.168.1.11
gotcha.. did u try to restart?
Yes, it didn't do any good
if that doesn't work. REMOVE the static IP config
then restart...
My question more specifically... anyone here with a WORKING WWAN CARD on a SONY LAPTOP?
An inbuilt one, or Sierra Wireless?
